etymology.description: Depicts a person standing upright, showing legs
etymology.interpretation: The character 儿(兒) (ér) originally represents a stylized depiction of a person, particularly emphasizing the legs as if they are walking or standing. This provides a visual representation of the concept 'person'.

examples.chinese: 他是个勇敢的儿(他是個勇敢的兒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì gè yǒnggǎn de ér.

examples.chinese: 村里有一个勤劳的儿(村里有一個勤勞的兒)，总帮助邻居解决问题(總幫助鄰居解決問題)。
examples.pinyin: Cūn lǐ yǒu yī gè qínláo de ér, zǒng bāngzhù línjū jiějué wèntí.
examples.english: There is a hardworking person in the village, who always helps neighbors solve problems.

examples.chinese: 古城中流传着一位智者儿(古城中流傳著一位智者兒)，他的故事激励后人(他的故事激勵後人)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ chéng zhōng liúchuán zhe yī wèi zhìzhě de ér, tā de gùshì jīlì hòurén.
examples.english: In the ancient city, the story of a wise person is passed down, and his tale inspires future generations.
